commit_message:
P5.5: Additional changes to db layer.

This adds to the changes made in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670463.

. Add additional ARQ states: DELETING and UNBOUND.
. Do not allocate attach handle based on attach type because:
  - Each deployable today has only one type of attach handle,
    either 'PCI' or 'TEST_PCI'. So, deployable id alone is enough.
  - The fake driver uses 'TEST_PCI' and others use 'PCI', but the
    generic code should not be aware of the driver type.
. Make device profile names unique. Previous schema made the
  (uuid, name) pair unique.

The 'update_for_nova_integ' migration script is extended further.
Usually, a new migration script gets introduced for each change but:
. Too many migration scripts can slow down upgrades for operators.
. While we should never update an migration script after a release,
  they are fair game within a release because only developers are
  involved. If the change helps save time for operators, it is worth it.

Change-Id: I14b2b1bc1fa02f9647931e03b8d3bc694ef85d32

commit_message:
Remove deprecated params and drivers

This patch does a lot of cleanup in the cinder module.
It does the following:

* Removes all deprecated parameters that can be removed
  in this release.

* Removes the bdd (block device driver) that is removed
  from cinder [1].

* Adds deprecation notices for cinder::type and
  cinder::type_set classes that had a comment about it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/711e88a8f9f8322f02a434bbe00417580715cacd

Change-Id: Ic75547396ddf3e553023583d987500f77909d277

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-07 20:38:48.000000000', 'message': "Update 'test_reset_backup_status' test

The 'test_reset_backup_status' test uses the instance-level
create_backup which has teardown issues when using certain
storage backends. When using Ceph, the volume backup is not
able to be deleted because of permission issues with Swift
and therefore causes a resource leak. Instead use the volume/rbac_base.py
'_create_backup' which does not have this issue.

Change-Id: I8796c6d9391b1965b3b8fd1fa1f8e347f26b64e8
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 21:00:55.000000000', 'message': "Update 'test_reset_backup_status' test

The 'test_reset_backup_status' test uses the instance-level
create_backup which has teardown issues when using certain
storage backends. When using Ceph, the volume backup is not
able to be deleted because of permission issues with Swift
and therefore causes a resource leak. Instead use the volume/rbac_base.py
'_create_backup' which does not have this issue.

Change-Id: I8796c6d9391b1965b3b8fd1fa1f8e347f26b64e8
"}]
commit_message:
Update 'test_reset_backup_status' test

The 'test_reset_backup_status' test uses the instance-level
create_backup which has teardown issues when using certain
storage backends. When using Ceph, the volume backup is not
able to be deleted because of permission issues with Swift
and therefore causes a resource leak. Instead use the volume/rbac_base.py
'_create_backup' which does not have this issue.

Change-Id: I8796c6d9391b1965b3b8fd1fa1f8e347f26b64e8

commit_message:
Fix race in execution finishing

An execution state can go from RUNNING to SUCCESS between fetching the
last message from the websocket and polling the execution state. This
means the SUCCESS payload is never returned and the overcloud
deployment fails at the end with no indication as to why.

This change turns the output of the execution into the last payload,
allowing the calling SUCCESS logic to run.

Change-Id: Ic22021ba9a2717de199629e361c656e2f562fb38
Closes-Bug: #1842987

[{'created': '2019-08-27 09:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Handle deprecation of inspect.getargspec

getargspec has been deprecated in py3 with plans to remove it in py3.6.
The recommendation is to move to inspect.signature, but the results of
that call are different than the existing one.

There is also getfullargspec available under py3 that was originally
deprecated, but for the sake of handling 2/3 code, it has been
un-deprecated. This call uses inspect internally, but returns a mostly
compatible result with what getargspec did. This handles getargspec
deprecation by just using getfullargspec instead if it is available

Change-Id: Id0104f7e2b4c43725cb6bcd5e0cd905b19e3133e

commit_message:
Handle deprecation of inspect.getargspec

getargspec has been deprecated in py3 with plans to remove it in py3.6.
The recommendation is to move to inspect.signature, but the results of
that call are different than the existing one.

There is also getfullargspec available under py3 that was originally
deprecated, but for the sake of handling 2/3 code, it has been
un-deprecated. This call uses inspect internally, but returns a mostly
compatible result with what getargspec did. This handles getargspec
deprecation by just using getfullargspec instead if it is available

Change-Id: Id0104f7e2b4c43725cb6bcd5e0cd905b19e3133e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ML2 plugin: extract and postpone limit in port query

as with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656066/ if limit is applied in
any place other than at the end of the filters, sql alchemy will return
an error, and possibily we could return less result than intended.

Change-Id: I9a54ae99d2d5dfda63cb0061bcf3d727ed7cc992
Closes-Bug: #1827363
(cherry picked from commit 94bc403078b1e5d2cddc697fc59b7f1d2d8a6045)

commit_message:
tox: Slight tweaks

- Use 'ignore_basepython_conflict' and set 'basepython' globally,
  avoiding the need to do it in each environment
- Set 'commands' in the top-level 'testenv' and just reference this
  where needed
- Remove unneeded 'setenv'

Change-Id: Ib2ac6279abf5cf3fa39cb1b72622e41c502429b5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for tosca definition version 1.2

* Added support for tosca definition version 1.2. for validating both
'CSAR with the TOSCA-Metadata directory' and 'CSAR without the
TOSCA-Metadata directory'.
* Added support to validate external references in imports files.

Note: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673386/ should also be merge
before this patch because in case of capabilities without properties
validation of csar file will break.

Specs: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/582930/

Change-Id: If8155399df12a96cb86631dfa22eaca7a5a8d398

commit_message:
python-glareclient: move to python3

Documentation is currently disable as upstream hasn't moved to
openstackdocstheme yet.

Included a patch for fixing failing tests on python3.
(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/587628/)

Change-Id: I1251eef1c5e5ed9e919b124c51a0e81226fa3532

[{'created': '2019-09-10 04:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'ec2-api: Fix Requires for subpackages

The subpackages (api, s3, metadata) need a Requires for
openstack-ec2-api, not for python3-ec2-api.
Otherwise the service start fails due to missing
files (/var/log/ec2-api, /var/lib/X, /etc/ec2api/, ...).

Change-Id: Ieb4dec373ad6fcb17810c0d588fb33ffb9d576d2
'}]
commit_message:
ec2-api: Fix Requires for subpackages

The subpackages (api, s3, metadata) need a Requires for
openstack-ec2-api, not for python3-ec2-api.
Otherwise the service start fails due to missing
files (/var/log/ec2-api, /var/lib/X, /etc/ec2api/, ...).

Change-Id: Ieb4dec373ad6fcb17810c0d588fb33ffb9d576d2

oslo-config-generator expects the config options to be a list of tuples:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html

Change-Id: I90f8512cc4a56a8092c585ecb665864a1c19b65a

commit_message:
Allow plugins to return config options as list of tuples

oslo-config-generator expects the config options to be a list of tuples:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html

This change allows us to us the same format and avoid having to define
two virtually identical functions.

Change-Id: I90f8512cc4a56a8092c585ecb665864a1c19b65a

'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 12:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: PDF documentation build

When we use a project badge (which comes from the included README.rst
at the top directory), it turns out that a filename conflict between
the generated PDF file name and a PDF file converted from an SVG image
of the project badge. Both uses neutron-dynamic-routing.pdf
(<repository-name>.pdf). To verify the PDF build works, a different
file name for PDF docs (doc-<repo-name>.pdf) is used temporarily
until the docs team agree the final solution.

Change-Id: I809040e0a4def90451f9a80c02c6f811af330bc9
Story: 2006099
Task: 35128
'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 13:15:50.000000000', 'message': 'PDF documentation build

Note that toctree_only option [1] is set to True in latex_documents
in doc/source/conf.py to get a better document architecture in
the generated PDF file.

The above solution also helps us avoid a filename conflict between
the generated PDF file name and a PDF file converted from an SVG image
of the project badge where both files would be neutron-dynamic-routing.pdf.

Change-Id: I809040e0a4def90451f9a80c02c6f811af330bc9
Story: 2006099
Task: 35128

PDF documentation build

Note that toctree_only option [1] is set to True in latex_documents
in doc/source/conf.py to get a better document structure in
the generated PDF file.

The above solution also helps us avoid a filename conflict between
the generated PDF file name and a PDF file converted from an SVG image
of the project badge where both files would be neutron-dynamic-routing.pdf.

Change-Id: I809040e0a4def90451f9a80c02c6f811af330bc9
Story: 2006099
Task: 35128

commit_message:
Ensure to call patch_middleware_get_user() in api.test_base

ApiHelperTests.test_url_for in openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.test_base
depends on keystone user and token information. To make this work,
we need to call utils.patch_middleware_get_user().
This commit changes ApiHelperTests to inherit APITestCase.

Change-Id: I3848f756604262b07700a65e9be5bacd48da191f
Closes-Bug: #1815285
(cherry picked from commit 4bf069bb9292710ed86be245c1b091b0a7a7d678)

commit_message:
Strip two more accept headers from object-storage

According to Tim Burke, the 'bytes' header isn't recognized by swift.
The other empty accept continues to seem like a bad idea.

commit_message:
django22: Django now truncates using the ellipsis character

As seen here [1]. One wonders if we're coupling ourselves rather tightly
to Django internals.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/commit/201017df308

Change-Id: Ifdcdc540f6027c05eadec6445543842f8cc00e2b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Parse required_floatingips parameter as a JSON array

An API request to create a floating IP reservation is expected to pass
the required_floatingips parameter as a list, not as a string. Modify
the CLI to parse required_floatingips as a JSON array so it can be
passed to the API in the right format.

Change-Id: Ia84ceb881f0889266c8f0349a1ffb047597bac2d
Closes-Bug: #1843258

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 18:21:46.000000000', 'message': 'Implement system admin for trusts API

This change enables a system admin to delete trusts. Previously, only
the trustor or the is_admin admin could delete a trust. This changes
makes the trusts API more useful to system administrators who need to
clean up trusts and makes the API consistent with others.

This does not enable system admins to create trusts. A trust can only be
scoped to a project, so creating one is inherently a project-scoped
action. If trusts later gain the ability to be scoped to the system or
domains, we can add those scopes to the create_trust scope_types.

Change-Id: Idf13b862f345388bb2372609787947eb43d7ba75
Closes-bug: #1818846
Partial-bug: #1818850
Related-Bug: #968696
'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 18:56:57.000000000', 'message': 'Implement system admin for trusts API

makes the trusts API more useful to system administrators who need to

scoped to a project, so creating one is inherently a project-scoped

This change enables a system admin to delete trusts. Previously, only
the trustor or the is_admin admin could delete a trust. This changes
makes the trusts API more useful to system administrators who need to
clean up trusts and makes the API consistent with others.

This does not enable system admins to create trusts. A trust can only be

action. If trusts later gain the ability to be scoped to the system or
domains, we can add those scopes to the create_trust scope_types.

Change-Id: Idf13b862f345388bb2372609787947eb43d7ba75
Closes-bug: #1818846
Closes-bug: #1818850
Related-Bug: #968696
'}]
commit_message:
Implement system admin for trusts API

This change enables a system admin to delete trusts. Previously, only
the trustor or the is_admin admin could delete a trust. This changes
makes the trusts API more useful to system administrators who need to
clean up trusts and makes the API consistent with others.

This does not enable system admins to create trusts. A trust can only be
scoped to a project, so creating one is inherently a project-scoped
action. If trusts later gain the ability to be scoped to the system or
domains, we can add those scopes to the create_trust scope_types.

Change-Id: Idf13b862f345388bb2372609787947eb43d7ba75
Closes-bug: #1818846
Closes-bug: #1818850
Related-Bug: #968696

commit_message:
Increase TestDhcpAgentHA.agent_down_time to 30 seconds

Currently there is a delay (around 20 seconds) between the the agent
update call and the server reply, due to the testing servers load. This
time should be higher than the agent-server communication delay but
still short enough to detect when the DHCP agent is dead during the
active wait during the DHCP agent network rescheduling.

"log_agent_heartbeats" is activated to add information about when the
server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py

Change-Id: Icf9a8802585c908fd4a70d0508139a81d5ac90ee
Related-Bug: #1799555
(cherry picked from commit d7c5ae8a0378fa50853e91241426b6470ffe7492)

[{'created': '2019-08-05 17:49:25.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use orjson in python3 for allocation candidate dump

orjson [1] is about 2x faster than the stdlib json library when
dump large objects however it comes with a couple of caveats:

* It only works for python>=3.5 (easy to work around)
* It only writes types that are native to JSON, so sets and default
  dicts need to be worked around (as seen in this change).

The results are useful though. A request which was taking 1.57 seconds
takes 1.35s with these changes. That doesn't sound like much, but it
a pretty reasonable improvement that in aggregate would add up.

A WIP because:

* we should talk about it
* we'd need global requirements
* we'd probably want to do it anywhere we dump large (for loads it would
  not be much of a win)

[1] https://pypi.org/project/orjson/

commit_message:
WIP: Use orjson in python3 for allocation candidate dump

orjson [1] is about 2x faster than the stdlib json library when
dumping large objects however it comes with a couple of caveats:

* It only works for python>=3.5 (easy to work around)
* It only writes types that are native to JSON, so sets and default
  dicts need to be worked around (as seen in this change).

The results are useful though. A request which was taking 0.953 seconds
takes 0.731s with these changes. That is, json dumping is 24.18% of
time when using the default code, but only 1.16% using the new.

A WIP because:

* we should talk about it
* we'd need global requirements
* we'd probably want to do it anywhere we dump large (for loads it would
  not be much of a win)

[1] https://pypi.org/project/orjson/

Change-Id: I4e4db57555e8d570c446c6432151c276996a42ac

[{'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:48:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I like the idea to move the timestamp to a sharable module, but I wouldn't call oslo (for me seems a little strange since it would be call in the driver part that is already an extension for oslo notifier) maybe timestamp?"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-05 15:09:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I like the idea to move the timestamp to a sharable module, but I wouldn't call oslo (for me seems a little strange since it would be call in the driver part that is already an extension for oslo notifier) maybe timestamp?


I thought to put everything related to oslo message in that module... Timestamp is just one of the possibly many registries.

Or does it make sense to have a module per registry?"}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-09-05 15:19:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think we would use any other registries from the oslo part, so having a specific for timestamp would be fine, I would say.
Do you have any other example of registries that would be useful to have as a metric?"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:35:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I do not have any other item that we might want to pull from message header.

If we look at other modules, they are named after the data source they process e.g. IPMI, redfish... That makes it logical to me to name the timestamp module after the data source it processes i.e. oslo notification message.

Does it make sense? May be instead of oslo, 'notification', 'message' or 'header' would sound better?

If we name it `timestamp`, that would appear inconsistent with the other modules...

WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sure! "header" would be better in my opinion =)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-09-05 18:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-09-09 15:07:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I'm ok with this, even if we have the description of the metric hardcoded (since we moved to another module and the description was in the ipmi json) =)
It's a minor fix, so we can move with this and I will provide a fix after we merge this one."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-09-09 15:19:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I'm ok with this, even if we have the description of the metric hardcoded (since we moved to another module and the description was in the ipmi json) =)

Does the follow up [1] solve this concern? Or I misunderstood it. %-)

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681007"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-09-10 09:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Move timestamp registry to a sharable 'header' module

The timestamp registry is going to be used by other parsers
in the future. Thus it seems reasonable to move if from ipmi
to something sharable.

Conceptually, `timestamp_registry` operates on Oslo message
header - perhaps we can have a dedicated parser module for
such common things - 'header'.

Change-Id: I2ba2f0ae28f09dbccd818c82005d47c7a515dfd4

server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py

Change-Id: Icf9a8802585c908fd4a70d0508139a81d5ac90ee
Related-Bug: #1799555
(cherry picked from commit d7c5ae8a0378fa50853e91241426b6470ffe7492)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase TestDhcpAgentHA.agent_down_time to 30 seconds

Currently there is a delay (around 20 seconds) between the the agent
update call and the server reply, due to the testing servers load. This
time should be higher than the agent-server communication delay but
still short enough to detect when the DHCP agent is dead during the
active wait during the DHCP agent network rescheduling.

"log_agent_heartbeats" is activated to add information about when the
server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py

Change-Id: Icf9a8802585c908fd4a70d0508139a81d5ac90ee
Related-Bug: #1799555
(cherry picked from commit d7c5ae8a0378fa50853e91241426b6470ffe7492)

subject: Add a cloud_config recipe
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11915, 'name': 'Jan Klare', 'email': 'jan@bisdn.de', 'username': 'jklare'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 19193, 'name': 'Christoph Albers', 'email': 'c.albers@x-ion.de', 'username': 'calbers'}, {'_account_id': 21961, 'name': 'Lance Albertson', 'email': 'lance@osuosl.org', 'username': 'ramereth'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-08-22 08:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-08-22 08:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

A couple of questions for my fellow reviewers:

Does it make sense to have this as an additional recipe? Or would you rather see the existing recipe extended?'}, {'account_id': 19193, 'date': '2019-08-22 11:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11915, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, looks good for a first implementation. The new template and recipe for the cloud config looks very static. Since the format it yaml, it might be possible to use a more flexible generation method for it which is directly based on the attributes. Also I do not fully understand why we remove the API version from both files. Will identity v3 be the last version ever? If not, we probably would need to reintroduce this variable at a later stage.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-08-27 15:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

According to the docs [1], it should be sourcing this file in the current directory without needing to source openrc. However when I do that, I get the following:

  [root@minimal-centos-7 ~]# openstack user list
  Missing value auth-url required for auth plugin password
  [root@minimal-centos-7 ~]# pwd
  /root

It looks like you need to specify --os-cloud for it to work properly:

  [root@minimal-centos-7 ~]# openstack --os-cloud default user list
  +----------------------------------+---------------+
  | ID                               | Name          |
  +----------------------------------+---------------+
  | 0b4185fc05f04da5a428a83b459cab3f | admin         |
  | 0bc44cf41a32459f9777009249bb1cba | ironic        |
  | 1ac79c0d4a5f434a8c411de99793c1ab | placement     |
  | 76838d69398c406a879fef9cdbf288f2 | neutron       |
  | 7c05abb87546474699f426a8708759b3 | tempest_user1 |
  | e24e180d26064fcb8c71ecd07a959a90 | nova          |
  | e38615b90798496abd518d61f443877b | glance        |
  | e56dd296cef84a7e8c8a2581e39bbce7 | tempest_user2 |
  +----------------------------------+---------------+

I couldn't find anything in documentation in what the default value for --os-cloud might be other than setting OS_CLOUD in the env var. I'm not sure if this is an issue or a "feature" but I thought I might bring it up.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/rocky/configuration/index.html'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-08-30 14:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-08-30 14:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the reviews. 

I don't think that osc can use the cloud_config without any configuration. The easiest option similar to sourcing openrc would be to do "export OS_CLOUD=default".

Regarding Identity > v3, there is no new version planned yet and it looked wrong to me to hardcode a version in the recipe to be passed into the template, so I moved that directly into the templates. If there ever is a new Identity API version, very likely we will have to touch much of this code anyway, so I don't see that as a drawback.

Finally regarding generating more flexible yaml output, if you have a good solution for that, I'll be happy to see a patch. For now, I think this is simple enough and not likely to change much. Deployers with a more general setup can always generate their own recipe to create a more complex cloud config.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-08-30 14:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-08-30 17:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thanks for the reviews.
 > 
 > I don't think that osc can use the cloud_config without any
 > configuration. The easiest option similar to sourcing openrc would
 > be to do "export OS_CLOUD=default".
 
+1 on doing that!

 > Regarding Identity > v3, there is no new version planned yet and it
 > looked wrong to me to hardcode a version in the recipe to be passed
 > into the template, so I moved that directly into the templates. If
 > there ever is a new Identity API version, very likely we will have
 > to touch much of this code anyway, so I don't see that as a
 > drawback.
 
1+ I agree we'd have to go back and touch the go so this isn't an issue.

 > Finally regarding generating more flexible yaml output, if you have
 > a good solution for that, I'll be happy to see a patch. For now, I
 > think this is simple enough and not likely to change much.
 > Deployers with a more general setup can always generate their own
 > recipe to create a more complex cloud config.

I think let's leave it as-is. If someone in the community wants to provide a patch which allows more flexibility, we can consider it then. This is a good first crack at getting this added.'}, {'account_id': 19193, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add a cloud_config recipe

Using a cloud config file when accessing a cloud is the modern variant
of setting lots of environment variables, so we add a new recipe that
produces a cloud config matching what we are deploying.

Clean up the old openrc template a bit.

Change-Id: I8574d9f4299be5b2a374140b461ef48e9e80ae6b

commit_message:
Exclude influxdb 5.2.3 for python

This version of influxdb client does not handle correctly unicode
characters with Python 2 [1].

git issue: https://github.com/influxdata/influxdb-python/issues/633
global-requirements change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679608/

Change-Id: Ibcf92256be2550db17c867ee592fbff2d6d047b0

Move get_resource() from the client to the journal

This is a function that relates to the journal and not to the client.

This patch moves it to the journal.

commit_message:
django22: Add 'renderer' argument

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  Support for Widget.render() methods without the renderer argument is
  removed.

Simply add the argument.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1

Change-Id: I48ac79464cf10011c1b2d45556aea5b107f2fc7f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Reduce the clutter in the REST client

The current REST client has two methods that are used to make a REST
request, sendjson() and request(). The problem with this is that it
creates some confusion as to which method to use.

This patch simplifies the API by consolidating the functionality of both
under a new method send_request().

Change-Id: Iaff4e7d04c3ea42f38a5280b07f7b34022432e89

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-31 08:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight

At present, ODL driver code does not allow bgpvpn to be associated with
multiple routers. This fix removes that check and allows multiple
router associations for a bgpvpn.

This fix is required for supporting dual stack vms as detailed in ODL spec:
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/54089/

Change-Id: Ide3c8b406c9916f717d1bd635c944f45f27f0ff1
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight

At present, ODL driver code does not allow bgpvpn to be associated with
multiple routers. This fix removes that check and allows multiple
router associations for a bgpvpn.

If ODL supports this feature, ODL will provide bgpvpn_multiple_routers feature attribute in the feature list during features negotiation.

This fix is required for supporting dual stack vms as detailed in ODL spec:
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/54089/

Change-Id: Ide3c8b406c9916f717d1bd635c944f45f27f0ff1
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
use callback payloads for ROUTER_CONTROLLER events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for ROUTER_CONTROLLER events. In addition it updates the unit tests to
also use payloads for ROUTER_CONTROLLER based events.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/636394/
Change-Id: I2bbff0ea8a745fde2e3ddb7ce869cb394519cff3

[{'created': '2019-08-24 14:35:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add allowed-projects to static publish jobs

The jobs publish-tox-docs-static and promote-tox-docs-static publish
content to specific web sites, ensure that they are only used by the
repositories that should publish there. This is done with adding an
allowed-projects declaration for current users of the jobs.

commit_message:
Add allowed-projects to static publish jobs

The jobs publish-tox-docs-static and promote-tox-docs-static publish
content to specific web sites, ensure that they are only used by the
repositories that should publish there. This is done with adding an
allowed-projects declaration for current users of the jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678352
Change-Id: I796cff233f7a8d1380f163aea1b4fc2d3059c16b

subject: Build pdf doc
messages:
[{'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-06-21 08:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-09-05 08:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-05 08:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You need to specify latex_use_xindy = False in doc/source/conf.py.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-09-05 09:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> You need to specify latex_use_xindy = False in doc/source/conf.py.

Thanks Akihiro, I did build docs with xindy in previous patch set locally. Just wonder why we don't install it in the docs job?"}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-09-05 09:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-09-05 13:22:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I did build docs with xindy in previous patch set locally. Just wonder why we don't install it in the docs job?

It is because xindy is not available in RPM based distros like Fedora now.
Perhaps https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1643664 tracks it."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looking at the generated PDF file, there seems several things to be improved, but it is up to the project team.

- "Indices and Tables" looks unnecessary in PDF
- "Python module index" covers only some of modules (perhaps...) so it might be better to skip them.
- The content of "INDEX" is weird. It can be skipped. I have no idea on how to improve its rendering. More LaTeX expert might be able to address it though.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

this is probably the best we can get at the moment
we can improve formatting and remove not necessary things in a follow-up'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Looking at the generated PDF file, there seems several things to be
 > improved, but it is up to the project team.
 > 
 > - "Indices and Tables" looks unnecessary in PDF
 > - "Python module index" covers only some of modules (perhaps...) so
 > it might be better to skip them.
 > - The content of "INDEX" is weird. It can be skipped. I have no
 > idea on how to improve its rendering. More LaTeX expert might be
 > able to address it though.

I have tested locally, bypassed genindex, search, but the index is still in the output, no idea :/'}]

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I16953e68b398108b702afdaddbb4460874b08792

commit_message:
Implement watcher datamodel list in watcher-decision-engine

1. Add datamodel list endpoint and rpc process.
2. Add datamodel list parased and return.
3. Add related unittest.

Partially Implements:blueprint show-datamodel-api

Change-Id: I758b7ca2bc3d8d596d3457277744336c6629bc4e

commit_message:
Upgrade jsonschema upper version

In [1], requirements.upper-constraints.txt, jsonschema library upper
version was bumped to 3.0.1. To avoid CI problems like [2], we should
remove the version limitation in this project.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649789/
[2]https://d4b9765f6ab6e1413c28-81a8be848ef91b58aa974b4cb791a408.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/680427/2/check/neutron-rally-task/01b2c1c/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Closes-Bug: #1843282

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 07:11:26.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude django.template DEBUG logs

As of now, we see VariableDoesNotExist error when rendering templates,
and this leads to too many DEBUG messages from django.template.
From my investigation, it does not affect actual behaviors of template
rendering so far (even though it is worth fixed), so it sounds reasonable
to me to disable DEBUG level messages from django.template until
the bug is addressed. It also helps developers dig into other errors.

Change-Id: I3b760865822977c7e0325ba9fd10db176983890e
Related-Bug: #1720893
'}, {'created': '2019-08-08 07:12:59.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude django.template DEBUG logs

As of now, we see VariableDoesNotExist error when rendering templates,
and this leads to too many DEBUG messages from django.template.
From my investigation, it does not affect actual behaviors of template
rendering so far (even though it is worth fixed), so it sounds reasonable
to me to disable DEBUG level messages from django.template until
the bug is addressed. It also helps developers dig into other errors.

Change-Id: I3b760865822977c7e0325ba9fd10db176983890e
Related-Bug: #1720893
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude django.template DEBUG logs

As of now, we see VariableDoesNotExist error when rendering templates,
and this leads to too many DEBUG messages from django.template.
From my investigation, it does not affect actual behaviors of template
rendering so far (even though it is worth fixed), so it sounds reasonable
to me to disable DEBUG level messages from django.template until
the bug is addressed. It also helps developers dig into other errors.

Change-Id: I3b760865822977c7e0325ba9fd10db176983890e
Related-Bug: #1720893

commit_message:
Restore nova-key tag

The nova-key tag is used to create and update SSH keys and
authorized keys among nova compute hosts. The execution
of this task isolated is a standard administrative task
to isolate and contain change to the minimum necessary activites.

Change-Id: I65d342b83649c626295c28096b3bb7c19e837fa9

commit_message:
Disable 'project_id' validation on test_share_servers

With the proposed change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671043/, the
share-server-list operation may not be able to retrieve the 'project_id'
attribute from the share-network because it might have already been deleted
from the system.

Change-Id: I13bb48e7c03e16c26946ccf9d48e80592391a3d1
Partially-implements: bp share-network-multiple-subnets
Needed-By: Id8814a8b26c9b9dcb1fe71d0d7e9b79e8b8a9210

commit_message:
Use a different venv per python executable

In a mixed py2/py3 setup python_venv_build currently tries to use
the same venv for both py2 and py3.

commit_message:
Revert "Move centos 7 buildah jobs to non-voting"

The job has been passing for the last 10 days in gates
Reverting it to voting.

This reverts commit e554e6ab629b17d2119e1b3def04171238527894.

Change-Id: Ibc6cab0c7feabbc2d0bafd4b5c89e9ddc1dde7a3

messages:
[{'account_id': 30950, 'date': '2019-09-10 00:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-10 00:45:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30950, 'date': '2019-09-10 00:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2019-09-10 01:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-30 11:55:45.000000000', 'message': "Microversion 2.76: Add delete_on_termination to volume-attach API

Support add 'delete_on_termination' field to the voume attach API to
support configuring whether to delete the data volume when the instance
is destroyed, and the ``delete_on_termination`` fields will be added the
GET responses when showing attached volumes.

* The '--delete-on-termination' will be add the `nova volume-attach` CLI.

Part of blueprint support-delete-on-termination-in-server-attach-volume
Change-Id: I8dcf2fd21a2fd99ca4e05bd953fbbe026be3a619

"}, {'created': '2019-09-04 10:09:50.000000000', 'message': "Microversion 2.78: Add delete_on_termination to volume-attach API

Support add 'delete_on_termination' field to the voume attach API to
support configuring whether to delete the data volume when the server
is destroyed.

Udating the ``nova volume-attachments`` command to show the
``delete_on_termination`` value if 2.78 or greater is used, and will be
add the 'DELETE ON TERMINATION' title to the list.

* The '--delete-on-termination' option is added to the `nova volume-attach` CLI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673133/
Part of blueprint support-delete-on-termination-in-server-attach-volume

Change-Id: I8dcf2fd21a2fd99ca4e05bd953fbbe026be3a619

commit_message:
Microversion 2.79: Add delete_on_termination to volume-attach API

Support add 'delete_on_termination' field to the voume attach API to
support configuring whether to delete the data volume when the server
is destroyed.

* Updating the ``nova volume-attachments`` command to show the
  ``delete_on_termination`` value if 2.79 or greater is used.
* The '--delete-on-termination' option is added to the `nova volume-attach`
  CLI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673133/
Part of blueprint support-delete-on-termination-in-server-attach-volume

Change-Id: I8dcf2fd21a2fd99ca4e05bd953fbbe026be3a619

commit_message:
nova: use systemd to check container healthchecks

Instead of running "podman exec" to test the container healthchecks, we
should rather rely on the status of systemd timers which reflect the
real state of the healthchecks, since they run under a specific user and
pid.

Also, we should only test the healthchecks if
ContainerHealthcheckDisabled is set to False.

Change-Id: I2c044e3d2af7f747acde5ad3bf256386b8c550a3
Closes-Bug: #1842687

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 11:55:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix systemd-journal-remote socket dependency

After I426dc8c29987e7b034a656e7d81321655ed6dbe2, a new installation
of systemd-journal-remote would fail to start, entering a restart
loop because of:
systemd-journal-remote[5089]: Received fewer sockets than expected

This is because the commit introduced a regression where the service
unit no longer depended on the socket, so systemd was not starting
the journal listening socket.

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: inactive (dead)
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)

Fixing this bug causes the socket to activate as expected when the
systemd-journal-remote service starts:

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Thu 2019-05-16 00:17:29 EDT; 4min 45s ago
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)
    Tasks: 0 (limit: 8192)
   CGroup: /system.slice/systemd-journal-remote.socket

May 16 00:17:29 infra1 systemd[1]: Listening on Journal Remote Sink Socket.

Change-Id: Ie0e2f376bd6a16f88801611b77fcfde5003d68e2
(cherry picked from commit 81578062a4b921ab7177b68b98846ca78de5530f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd-journal-remote socket dependency

After I426dc8c29987e7b034a656e7d81321655ed6dbe2, a new installation
of systemd-journal-remote would fail to start, entering a restart
loop because of:
systemd-journal-remote[5089]: Received fewer sockets than expected

This is because the commit introduced a regression where the service
unit no longer depended on the socket, so systemd was not starting
the journal listening socket.

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: inactive (dead)
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)

Fixing this bug causes the socket to activate as expected when the
systemd-journal-remote service starts:

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Thu 2019-05-16 00:17:29 EDT; 4min 45s ago
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)
    Tasks: 0 (limit: 8192)
   CGroup: /system.slice/systemd-journal-remote.socket

May 16 00:17:29 infra1 systemd[1]: Listening on Journal Remote Sink Socket.

Change-Id: Ie0e2f376bd6a16f88801611b77fcfde5003d68e2
(cherry picked from commit 81578062a4b921ab7177b68b98846ca78de5530f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 19:26:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add named debug tasks to each play

Named debug ansible tasks have been added to the plays that get
generated in deploy_steps_playbook.yaml (from common/deploy-steps.j2).
The explicitly named tasks allow for using ansible-playbook's
--start-at-task option to resume a deployment from the start of a given
play.

For example, this could be used to resume a deployment with:
ansible-playbook ... --start-at-task "Overcloud common deploy step tasks 3" ...

Previously this was not possible since many of the tasks that got
generated in common_deploy_steps_tasks.yaml used an ansible variable in
the name, which is not resolved until runtime, so --start-at-task is
ignored.

Change-Id: If40a5ecaacf8c74c98775eb6bde05d967694f640

commit_message:
Add named debug tasks to each play

Named debug ansible tasks have been added to the plays that get
generated in deploy_steps_playbook.yaml (from common/deploy-steps.j2).
The explicitly named tasks allow for using ansible-playbook's
--start-at-task option to resume a deployment from the start of a given
play.

For example, this could be used to resume a deployment with:
ansible-playbook ... --start-at-task "Overcloud common deploy step tasks 3" ...

Previously this was not possible since many of the tasks that got
generated in common_deploy_steps_tasks.yaml used an ansible variable in
the name, which is not resolved until runtime, so --start-at-task is
ignored.

Change-Id: If40a5ecaacf8c74c98775eb6bde05d967694f640

commit_message:
Honor trash_output when not using queue

Previously, trash_output was not honored if a queue was not being used
to post messages.

This patch changes the behavior so that trash_output will be honored
even if a queue is not being used, and all stdout/stderr will be
discarded.

Change-Id: I4fccfa0cb2a5382a52d63598f66dae446ff29c25
Closes-Bug: #1842102
(cherry picked from commit c7d44bc2ca67c40098982c88e9625aacd25b780d)

messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-06 13:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-06 16:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-09 19:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 14:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850
(cherry picked from commit 7e5b133122d2fdda19fcfa845e1218970627727c)
'}]
commit_message:
Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850
(cherry picked from commit 7e5b133122d2fdda19fcfa845e1218970627727c)

subject: Don't run sensu_client in privileged mode
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 12:24:29.000000000', 'message': "Don't run sensu_client in privileged mode

Running in privileged mode creates conflict ([1]) when interacting with systemd
via systemctl. We should instead use --cap-add whe some regression caused
by missing capability will arise.

[1] WARNING: The same type, major and minor should not be used for multiple devices.
Running in chroot, ignoring request: <any systemctl action>

Change-Id: I81b6539e088f6c90fb9c46588441592d19c110af
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run sensu_client in privileged mode

Running in privileged mode creates conflict ([1]) when interacting with systemd
via systemctl. We should instead use --cap-add whe some regression caused
by missing capability will arise.

[1] WARNING: The same type, major and minor should not be used for multiple devices.
Running in chroot, ignoring request: <any systemctl action>

Change-Id: I81b6539e088f6c90fb9c46588441592d19c110af

subject: Add else statement when running leapp without SKIP_DEVEL.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-09-09 10:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-09-09 19:12:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nMerging as it's blocking CI"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-09 10:16:45.000000000', 'message': "Add else statement when running leapp without SKIP_DEVEL.

If leapp_unsubscribed is set to false, the condition won't be
met and the environment variable won't be included. However,
Ansible complains that there is no else statement and the task
fails: the inline if-expression on line 2 evaluated to false and n
o else section was defined. Adding the else statemnt to include
an empty string to solve the issue.

Change-Id: I8a52da5ca81e61a9dd5f39997535965a75a5abba
(cherry picked from commit 4e305799600e104092087f566a15907a348b58e5)
"}]
commit_message:
Add else statement when running leapp without SKIP_DEVEL.

If leapp_unsubscribed is set to false, the condition won't be
met and the environment variable won't be included. However,
Ansible complains that there is no else statement and the task
fails: the inline if-expression on line 2 evaluated to false and n
o else section was defined. Adding the else statemnt to include
an empty string to solve the issue.

Change-Id: I8a52da5ca81e61a9dd5f39997535965a75a5abba
(cherry picked from commit 4e305799600e104092087f566a15907a348b58e5)

commit_message:
Remove bootstrap_nodeid group var

The bootstrap_nodeid group var is no longer needed coming out of Heat
because it's value can be calculated entirely with the Ansible jinja2
template.

commit_message:
Temporarily switch master jobs to OVS 2.12 branch

While we adjust the jobs to build OVN from the new repo,
this patch is switching jobs that build OVS/OVN from master to
use the recently created branch-2.12.

In addition, make rally non-voting until
[1] is merged, the gate is broken there as well. So since there
are two separate issues breaking the gate, they can't depend on
each other to merge so fix it here. (It appears to be past
working hours for rally-core)

This patch must be reverted when [0] and [1] get merged.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673236/
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681001/
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I63d12861e1ff5d444d116188a2a122eca5c45af0

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users for trusts

Users with any role on a domain have no ability to use trusts. That
privilege is only granted to project users, who may create trusts for
their own project and list and delete their own trusts, and system
users, who may audit and clean up trusts. This change adds tests to
verify that behavior.

Change-Id: I8404c062cc07ef83bf77fdd9178919aff0a0d6d5
Partial-bug: #1818850

commit_message:
Use created subnet in port generator in "test_port_ip_update_revises"

We are hitting sometimes a problem in "test_port_ip_update_revises" [1].
This happens because the port created doesn't belong to the previously
created subnet. We need to enforce that the port is created in the
subnet specifically created in this test.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/69/650269/12/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/7adf36e/testr_results.html.gz

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py

Change-Id: I399f100fe30b6a03248cef5e6026204d4d1ffb2e
Closes-Bug: #1828865
(cherry picked from commit 872dd7f48400f0ee059876b01d4034aa75f97787)

Use created subnet in port generator in "test_port_ip_update_revises"

We are hitting sometimes a problem in "test_port_ip_update_revises" [1].
This happens because the port created doesn't belong to the previously
created subnet. We need to enforce that the port is created in the
subnet specifically created in this test.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/69/650269/12/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/7adf36e/testr_results.html.gz

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py

commit_message:
Increase TestDhcpAgentHA.agent_down_time to 30 seconds

Currently there is a delay (around 20 seconds) between the the agent
update call and the server reply, due to the testing servers load. This
time should be higher than the agent-server communication delay but
still short enough to detect when the DHCP agent is dead during the
active wait during the DHCP agent network rescheduling.

"log_agent_heartbeats" is activated to add information about when the
server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py

Change-Id: Icf9a8802585c908fd4a70d0508139a81d5ac90ee
Related-Bug: #1799555
(cherry picked from commit d7c5ae8a0378fa50853e91241426b6470ffe7492)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-09 16:23:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't duplicate PlacementFixture in libvirt func tests

libvirt/base.py inherits from test_servers.ServersTestBase which
itself mixes in _IntegratedTestBase. _IntegratedTestBase starts
the PlacementFixture so we don't need to do so a second time.

If we do, then the things can get very weird during the test
cleanUp period with misleading exception and requests made to
placement when it seems like placement should already be gone
(because the inner fixture has alread been cleaned up, but not
the outer).

Change-Id: I057a07c8d0b880c8d09fc2e618ce1f7fc885beda
"}]
commit_message:
Don't duplicate PlacementFixture in libvirt func tests

libvirt/base.py inherits from test_servers.ServersTestBase which
itself mixes in _IntegratedTestBase. _IntegratedTestBase starts
the PlacementFixture so we don't need to do so a second time.

If we do, then the things can get very weird during the test
cleanUp period with misleading exception and requests made to
placement when it seems like placement should already be gone
(because the inner fixture has alread been cleaned up, but not
the outer).

Change-Id: I057a07c8d0b880c8d09fc2e618ce1f7fc885beda

commit_message:
Drop mod_wsgi support

As we don't provide wsgi file for mod_wsgi deployment (despite
having task to do that) and trove package don't contain wsgi application
we should drop apache mod_wsgi part of the setup as it's not functional.

Change-Id: I0a12fad27d3f994d79ead52ac90873a1e1362144

commit_message:

This commit introduces some tests that show how domain users are
expected to behave with the policy assocation API. A subsequent
patches will -

 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file
Partial-Bug: #1805409

subject: tox.ini: fix venv commands
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 00:03:27.000000000', 'message': 'tox.ini: fix venv commands

When run venv without args:

    tox -e venv

The empty args make tox run into error:

     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tox/venv.py", line 507, in test
        if argv[0].startswith("-"):
    IndexError: list index out of range

Replace {posargs} to echo with helpful message.

Change-Id: I94ae4bf568449d326907812dd46ccf9c4d30cc3c
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-06 00:16:17.000000000', 'message': 'tox.ini: fix venv commands

When run venv without args:

    tox -e venv

The empty args make tox run into error:

     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tox/venv.py", line 507, in test
        if argv[0].startswith("-"):
    IndexError: list index out of range

Replace {posargs} to /bin/true.

Change-Id: I94ae4bf568449d326907812dd46ccf9c4d30cc3c
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
tox.ini: fix venv commands

When run venv without args:

    tox -e venv

The empty args make tox run into error:

     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tox/venv.py", line 507, in test
        if argv[0].startswith("-"):
    IndexError: list index out of range

Replace {posargs} to /bin/true.

Change-Id: I94ae4bf568449d326907812dd46ccf9c4d30cc3c
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Modify validation and add Molecule tests for rabbitmq-limits

We can't easily add host variables, meaning we have to modify the
validation in order to accept external variable.

The Molecule test validate it's still working as expected.

subject: tox.ini: use abs path for true cmd in func-noop
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 04:24:49.000000000', 'message': 'tox.ini: use abs path for true cmd in func-noop

Currently tox -e func-noop will print warning:

WARNING: test command found but not installed in testenv
cmd: /bin/true
env: /home/ubuntu/charm-builds/masakari/.tox/func-noop
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

DEPRECATION WARNING: this will be an error in tox 4 and above!

Use abs path for true cmd will fix it.

Change-Id: I5d119bb0518c7b12e5c549d17d4b8de2b5093c03
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>
'}]

commit_message:
tox.ini: use abs path for true cmd in func-noop

Currently `tox -e func-noop` will print warning:

WARNING: test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/true
  env: /home/ubuntu/charm-builds/vault/.tox/func-noop
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

DEPRECATION WARNING: this will be an error in tox 4 and above!

Use abs path for `true` cmd will fix it.

Change-Id: Icc5d6b30b0e4df0847e59c0fbc2e15c7fd2621fb
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Disable voting on container-updates until 678695 is merged"

Since https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678695/ is landed, we can re-enable
the voting again.

This reverts commit 16bafb628d5f5255c55e6997dfe0cd8bf02c43e0.

commit_message:
Migrate aodh to use uWSGI role

This patch moves aodh-api from usage of apache with mod_wsgi
to uWSGI role, which means unification across another roles and
reduced maintenance costs

During migration period tasks that ensures apache won't listen
on panko_service_port are present, but they are supposed to be removed
after train release.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678025/
Change-Id: I9377d46b4b79f79dbf448b23c67ff21b80714b6c

-1 since I didn't find any usage"}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We do want to keep the airship-core group, so that it can be added as a member of the new groups.  If we can keep the airship-core group without the airship.config ACL, then we can certainly remove the ACL.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:44:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you can keep the *group* but you don't need the ACL. Removing the file will not remove the group.

Per discussion at the last PTG, new Airship projects have been
getting created with per-project core groups, instead of the older
airship-core group.  This change catches up existing Airship projects
to this setup, as they either have new core reviewers being added
or will in the future.  A few projects which are closely and
logically related to other projects are configured to share their
ACLs for simplicity's sake.

With (or ahead of) this change, please seed the existing airship-core

uninterrupted review/merge ability.

Change-Id: I0c054714ca9a709bd58b85570a5c415a76cacd1c

Change-Id: I0c054714ca9a709bd58b85570a5c415a76cacd1c

commit_message:
Add per-project Airship groups

Per discussion at the last PTG, new Airship projects have been
getting created with per-project core groups, instead of the older
airship-core group.  This change catches up existing Airship projects
to this setup, as they either have new core reviewers being added
or will in the future.  A few projects which are closely and
logically related to other projects are configured to share their
ACLs for simplicity's sake.

Note that this removes the airship.config ACL, but we do need to retain
the airship-core group (for now).

With (or ahead of) this change, please seed the existing airship-core
group as a member of all the newly created groups, to ensure
uninterrupted review/merge ability.

Change-Id: I0c054714ca9a709bd58b85570a5c415a76cacd1c

commit_message:
Func test for migrate server with ports having resource request

A new functional test proves that bandwidth allocation is made on the
destination host during the migration and the binding:profile of the
port is updated to point to the destination resource provider.

As a result, migrate_instance_finish has to be un-stubbed in the
NeutronFixture to update the port's binding profile.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: Ia69dace6d3b395fa113c1382e8eb52c2cc36119d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 09:00:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix version handling compatible with python-semanticversion 2.8

It seems the behavior of 'partial' argument of Version class __init__
has been changed between semantic-version 2.6.0 and 2.8.1
(though I could not identify the root cause).
'partial' argument is marked as deprecated in semantic-vesion 2.7.0,
so it is a good chance not to depend on 'partial' argument in horizon.

This commit uses Version.coerce() [1] instead to convert non-semver
version into a valid semver version.
We also need to keep the original version information as it is passed
when initializing python-*client (cinderclient and keystoneclient).

Unit test coverage on dict behavior is improved.
Variable names in the unit tests are adjusted to more meaningful ones.

[1] https://python-semanticversion.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#coercing-an-arbitrary-version-string

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/680457
Change-Id: If0deee9d0289ff91d58d942b9612f7736356ae18
"}, {'created': '2019-09-09 06:42:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix version handling compatible with python-semanticversion 2.8

It seems the behavior of 'partial' argument of Version class __init__
has been changed between semantic-version 2.6.0 and 2.8.1
(though I could not identify the root cause).
'partial' argument is marked as deprecated in semantic-vesion 2.7.0,
so it is a good chance not to depend on 'partial' argument in horizon.

This commit uses Version.coerce() [1] instead to convert non-semver
version into a valid semver version.
We also need to keep the original version information as it is passed
when initializing python-*client (cinderclient and keystoneclient).

In addition, the previous implementation based on semantic-version 2.6.0
returns True for "Version("3.55") == 3". It depends on the behavior
of "partial" argument of semantic_version.Version. It was not
documented and it looks tricky to depend on this behavior.
"major" and "minor" properties are now introduced and api/cinder.py
is updated accordingly. I believe this approach is clearer and stable.

Unit test coverage on dict behavior is improved.
Variable names in the unit tests are adjusted to more meaningful ones.

It seems the behavior of 'partial' argument of Version class __init__
has been changed between semantic-version 2.6.0 and 2.8.1
(though I could not identify the root cause).
'partial' argument is marked as deprecated in semantic-vesion 2.7.0,
so it is a good chance not to depend on 'partial' argument in horizon.

This commit uses Version.coerce() [1] instead to convert non-semver
version into a valid semver version.
We also need to keep the original version information as it is passed
when initializing python-*client (cinderclient and keystoneclient).

In addition, the previous implementation based on semantic-version 2.6.0
returns True for "Version("3.55") == 3". It depends on the behavior
of "partial" argument of semantic_version.Version. It was not
documented and it looks tricky to depend on this behavior.
"major" and "minor" properties are now introduced and api/cinder.py
is updated accordingly. I believe this approach is clearer and stable.

Unit test coverage on dict behavior is improved.
Variable names in the unit tests are adjusted to more meaningful ones.

Change-Id: If0deee9d0289ff91d58d942b9612f7736356ae18
'}]
commit_message:
Fix version handling compatible with python-semanticversion 2.8

It seems the behavior of 'partial' argument of Version class __init__
has been changed between semantic-version 2.6.0 and 2.8.1
(though I could not identify the root cause).
'partial' argument is marked as deprecated in semantic-vesion 2.7.0,
so it is a good chance not to depend on 'partial' argument in horizon.

This commit uses Version.coerce() [1] instead to convert non-semver
version into a valid semver version.
We also need to keep the original version information as it is passed
when initializing python-*client (cinderclient and keystoneclient).

In addition, the previous implementation based on semantic-version 2.6.0
returns True for "Version("3.55") == 3". It depends on the behavior
of "partial" argument of semantic_version.Version. It was not
documented and it looks tricky to depend on this behavior.
"major" and "minor" properties are now introduced and api/cinder.py
is updated accordingly. I believe this approach is clearer and stable.

Unit test coverage on dict behavior is improved.
Variable names in the unit tests are adjusted to more meaningful ones.

[1] https://python-semanticversion.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#coercing-an-arbitrary-version-string

Change-Id: If0deee9d0289ff91d58d942b9612f7736356ae18

Let's not merge this yet please. I don't want to create any migrations for this functionality because it is not stable yet. Also, what's the meaning of this "scheduler_id" field and why did you remove timestamps?'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2019-07-18 17:58:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I agree that we should stabilize the solution first.
scheduler_id will be used to define what scheduler captured the job, it allows to optimize queries and quickly find jobs that belong to a given scheduler.
I removed the indices, because I think they are quite useless here - there shouldn't be a lot of rows in the table, just active jobs. So we can easily scan through them without indices. But there will be a lot of insertions and removals, and indices make these operations slower."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-09-05 08:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-09-05 08:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add a migration to create the scheduled_jobs table

This commit adds a required migration and additionally creates a
new field in the model called 'scheduler_id'.

Change-Id: I5436e34dec032b9028221e3e87c8d88a9b207e23

commit_message:
prepare func test env for moving servers with bandwidth

To be able to test server move operations with ports having resource
request (e.g. bandwidth) we need a bit of work on the functional test
env to be able to create two computes with bandwidth resources.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I4ed0381ec3bbcc9c72a7d5c0e232ac7b44241205

commit_message:
resize: Add bw min service level check of source compute

During resize the RequestSpec goes from the dest compute to the
source compute and then back to the dest. The previous patch [1] added
service level check for the dest compute. However the source compute also
needs to be new enough so the RequestSpec is passed through it.

Please note that the functional coverage for this api change is in a
later patch [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680394
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679019

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports
Change-Id: Ib1a73f5e20b6f9a325d8b24d9253a18f2a46db1f

commit_message:
migrate: Add bw min service level check of source compute

During cold migrate the RequestSpec goes from the dest compute to the
source compute and then back to the dest. The previous patch [1] added
service level check for the dest compute. However the source compute also
needs to be new enough so the RequestSpec is passed through it.

Please note that the functional coverage for this api change is in a
later patch [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680394
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655113

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports
Change-Id: I09cac780b9ee5b5726874d4e6f895fd0cd4bff8c

[{'created': '2019-09-05 12:44:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add min service level check for migrate with bandwidth

During resize and cold migrate the dest compute service needs to update
the port binding based on the re-calculated port - resource provider mapping.
This update happens in finish_resize.

To do that the dest compute service needs to be at least on service level
39.

The calculation is based on the RequestSpec. The RequestSpec is sent
to the dest compute in pre_resize but the dest compute only sends it to the
source compute in resize_instance if the compute rpc api version is at least
5.2. Also the source compute only sends the RequestSpec to the dest
compute in the finish_resize if the rpc api version is at least 5.2. So
migration with bandwidth only works if both compute talks at least 5.2
which means that the min service level is at least 39.

Change-Id: Ia500b105b9ec70c0d8bd38faa084270b825476eb

commit_message:
Add min service level check for migrate with bandwidth

During resize and cold migrate the dest compute service needs to update
the port binding based on the re-calculated port - resource provider mapping.
This update happens in finish_resize.

To do that the dest compute service needs to be at least on service level
39.

The calculation is based on the RequestSpec. The RequestSpec is sent
to the dest compute in pre_resize but the dest compute only sends it to the
source compute in resize_instance if the compute rpc api version is at least
5.2. Also the source compute only sends the RequestSpec to the dest
compute in the finish_resize if the rpc api version is at least 5.2. So
migration with bandwidth only works if both compute talks at least 5.2
which means that the min service level is at least 39.

Change-Id: Ia500b105b9ec70c0d8bd38faa084270b825476eb
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

In create_relationship, if VolumeBackendAPIException is caught and
'CMMVC5959E' is in e, then the exception will not be raised, and
then the next state of "if rc_id" will raise NameError exception,
so rc_id should be initialized to avoid this potential risk.

Change-Id: If8d214c205196c76125a6581c85cbfeee6b4dfbd
'}, {'created': '2019-09-05 01:43:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix potential NameError of rc_id

In create_relationship, if VolumeBackendAPIException is caught and
'CMMVC5959E' is in e, then the exception will not be raised, and
then the next state of "if rc_id" will raise NameError exception,

commit_message:
Fix potential NameError of rc_id

In create_relationship, if VolumeBackendAPIException is caught and
'CMMVC5959E' is in e, then the exception will not be raised, and
then the next state of "if rc_id" will raise NameError exception,
so rc_id should be initialized to avoid this potential risk.

Change-Id: If8d214c205196c76125a6581c85cbfeee6b4dfbd

commit_message:
Replace coremask with cpu_list in vrouter schema

Actually contrail_vrouter_dpdk takes cpu_list
parameter, see ContrailVrouterDpdk class.

Change-Id: I956ed91af627cb02f7117fd69b36dfce12734c45
(cherry picked from commit e8e61573629907846776db1063fb783d6c108525)

commit_message:
Remove NeutronAZConfig service from undercloud minion

The NeutronAZConfig service was removed in commit
20f34fc556a45f3bd408433a6be99553e863f8ed, so it can be removed from the
undercloud minion environments as well.

Change-Id: Ib5f3e872adab34570397be868b54ce06785f528a

subject: format_dict() returns no value for None
messages: [{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-09-02 14:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-09-02 20:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck angry-gate (aggregate)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-09-09 16:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 14:45:24.000000000', 'message': "format_dict() returns no value for None

We have some subtle cases to distinguish:
* value of None   (the Python literal)
* value of ''     (an empty string)
* value of 'None' (a string)

Return no representation of data when the value is the Python literal None
rather than the string 'None' which can be confused for an actual string value.

Returning an empty string ('') can be confused for an actual empty
string so that is also not an option.  By leaving off the quotes we can accurately
reflect the distinct value of None.

Change-Id: Icdc1712e626a7e8a706348586a6be2e7612c4376
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
format_dict() returns no value for None

We have some subtle cases to distinguish:
* value of None   (the Python literal)
* value of ''     (an empty string)
* value of 'None' (a string)

Return no representation of data when the value is the Python literal None
rather than the string 'None' which can be confused for an actual string value.

Returning an empty string ('') can be confused for an actual empty
string so that is also not an option.  By leaving off the quotes we can accurately
reflect the distinct value of None.

Change-Id: Icdc1712e626a7e8a706348586a6be2e7612c4376
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-07 04:40:38.000000000', 'message': "Override tox job timeouts

Currently our unit tests frequently hit the 40 minute timeout due to the
inefficiency of the protection unit tests. As a temporary workaround,
this change overrides the zuul tox jobs with a 60 minute timeout.
Overriding the values of jobs that are defined elsewhere in a project
template isn't exactly documented but it supposedly works[1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2019-09-06.log.html#t2019-09-06T23:35:57

Change-Id: I0b9e0fbbd1760fe2d55935592f4349f337801209
"}, {'created': '2019-09-08 01:49:31.000000000', 'message': "Override tox job timeouts

Currently our unit tests frequently hit the 40 minute timeout due to the
inefficiency of the protection unit tests. As a temporary workaround,

commit_message:
Override tox job timeouts

Currently our unit tests frequently hit the 40 minute timeout due to the
inefficiency of the protection unit tests. As a temporary workaround,
this change overrides the zuul tox jobs with a 60 minute timeout.
Overriding the values of jobs that are defined elsewhere in a project
template isn't exactly documented but it supposedly works[1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2019-09-06.log.html#t2019-09-06T23:35:57

Change-Id: I0b9e0fbbd1760fe2d55935592f4349f337801209

commit_message:
Upgrade jsonschema upper version

In [1], requirements.upper-constraints.txt, jsonschema library upper
version was bumped to 3.0.1. To avoid CI problems like [2], we should
remove the version limitation in this project.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649789/
[2]https://d4b9765f6ab6e1413c28-81a8be848ef91b58aa974b4cb791a408.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/680427/2/check/neutron-rally-task/01b2c1c/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Closes-Bug: #1843282
Change-Id: I0ac00de6987de8835d9cac8f73fdae00d2f212d6

commit_message:
Fix unit tests broken by requests-mock

Now requests-mock records request url in log[1], so it is
invalid to check that the logger output does NOT contain
request url.

Also, fix url passed to request mock as now it requires
complete url is passed

[1] https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock/pull/93

Change-Id: I4bab30a6705b7cab6b5a569dd61c442263e39995

commit_message:
Use promote job

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678351
Change-Id: I0c861bddabf83e72cd45d900a04d7b8bf8fde32f

commit_message:
StorPool: update the driver requirements.

Bump the storpool module's version to 4.0.0 for various
improvements and fixes.
Add storpool.spopenstack at its current version 2.2.1.
Add both storpool and storpool.spopenstack to setup.cfg and
lower-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I2764e1a5f1ec8bbd878a7b2346722ec723889b22

subject: Mark the StorPool driver as supported again.

commit_message:
Mark the StorPool driver as supported again.

The StorPool third-party CI system is up and running at
https://spfactory.storpool.com/

This reverts commit 07e6086ca23e4666e5ad90d58ca8c1af4b8f407d.

Change-Id: I9f41580c03f8a803cb32353d4f2ca207fa09b371

subject: Advertise some of the StorPool driver's capabilities.
