revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 20:53:31.000000000', 'message': "Invalidate cache when _refresh_associations fails

Per the referenced bug, it is possible for a node to disappear while
we're refreshing its associations in the cache. When this happens, we
now remove its cache entry entirely so that a subsequent refresh can
rebuild it from scratch.

Change-Id: I3fa2af344f94ecd71115f649eeab0f243823fe0b
Closes-Bug: #1841481
"}]
commit_message:
Invalidate cache when _refresh_associations fails

Per the referenced bug, it is possible for a node to disappear while
we're refreshing its associations in the cache. When this happens, we
now remove its cache entry entirely so that a subsequent refresh can
rebuild it from scratch.

Change-Id: I3fa2af344f94ecd71115f649eeab0f243823fe0b
Closes-Bug: #1841481

TBH, this role was never intended to have podman support as it's specifically about installing a container registry (podman has no concept of this).  I'd rather that we not introduce podman support so we can get rid of this role when we completely drop docker support"}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-08-22 16:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

so this change was created under request by EmilienM to not duplicate a role to log in into registries. I objected that the role did not support podman, but apperently adding it was not deemed a problem and I didnd't know you were planning to get completely rid of this role. Frankly I don't know what the plans are for podman without a registry. Even with podman we'll need to  login on dockerhub don't know for how long. Is it a problem if once you don't need this role anymore, you just dereference it while we continue using it ? Having the registry role is good to test that the login works anyway without using real credentials."}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-08-22 16:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-22 17:47:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

It would be better to create a CI specific role that could leverage this role for docker and then jsut do the simple podman tasks as necessary. We're already probably going to end up with a podman role in tripleo-ansible that could be reused if necessary"}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-08-26 13:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-27 14:15:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-30 10:52:48.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] expand login subtasks so it can be used in all rdo jobs

With the upcoming activation of RHEL8 pipeline, we decided with infra it
was better to switch rdo registry to restricted access.
This means that all the job in rdo must login to registry to pull
containers.
All the jobs must now call this role to login to the registry, so we are
expanding the login part to satisfy the workflow

Change-Id: I6e55bdcf493d04bfc88ae22154124a7888563147

commit_message:
expand login subtasks so it can be used in all rdo jobs

With the upcoming activation of RHEL8 pipeline, we decided with infra it
was better to switch rdo registry to restricted access.
This means that all the job in rdo must login to registry to pull
containers.
All the Centos7 jobs must now call this role to login to the registry,
so we are expanding the login part to satisfy the workflow
RHEL8 job with podman will use a internal role instead.

Change-Id: I6e55bdcf493d04bfc88ae22154124a7888563147

[{'created': '2019-09-06 01:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure doc/source/_static to fix docs gate

doc/source/_static directory is required by oslo.policy sample generator.

This commit adds a placeholder file to ensure doc/source/_static directory.

Change-Id: Ied6cbc80c4b384ed45c927f2aea8e88604f457fe
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure doc/source/_static to fix docs gate

doc/source/_static directory is required by oslo.policy sample generator.
The recent sphinx complains if _static directory is missing.
This commit adds a placeholder file to ensure doc/source/_static directory.

Change-Id: Ied6cbc80c4b384ed45c927f2aea8e88604f457fe

commit_message:
Honor trash_output when not using queue

Previously, trash_output was not honored if a queue was not being used
to post messages.

This patch changes the behavior so that trash_output will be honored
even if a queue is not being used, and all stdout/stderr will be
discarded.

Change-Id: I4fccfa0cb2a5382a52d63598f66dae446ff29c25
Closes-Bug: #1842102
